column4: I must have a menu.lst somewhere...and grub must be accessing it...but I can't find it anywhere
find / -name menu.lst -print
I did that already...no luck
and your os still boots?
yes, I can boot into 2.6.12-10-amd64-smp, a myriad of other options and my XP on another SATA drive
find "device.map" then
just to be sure, you are finding "menu.lst" (list) and not menu.1st( first), right?
what about device.map?
fantastic :)
okay, find vmlinuz*
i'd appreciate if you prefix your messages to me with my nick. what else is in /boot?
I have what looks like a whole lot of kernel files, vmlinuz-x... some config version, abis,
use pastebin.com to paste your whole "ls"
an initrd. img etc
I can't get to a web browswer
PM me then
I think pm's are not permissible?
you have to register with "nickserv" first
/msg nickserv help register -> or the other way around
thanks, is there a simple way to do this?
thanks
never a simple way :)
